thread.title: Mark Ronson becomes patron of Amy Winehouse Foundation
thread.title_full: Mark Ronson becomes patron of Amy Winehouse Foundation

title: Mark Ronson becomes patron of Amy Winehouse Foundation
text:
Mark Ronson becomes patron of Amy Winehouse Foundation Mark Ronson becomes patron of Amy Winehouse Foundation 
Press Association 2014 / / National Entertainment News Share 
Uptown Funk star Mark Ronson has said becoming a patron of his late friend Amy Winehouse’s charity is a “big deal”. 
The 40-year-old music producer is to lead a special performance to the singer, whom he worked with on the album Back To Black, at the fourth annual Amy Winehouse Foundation gala. 
The pair struck up a friendship after they collaborated on her second album in 2006, before her death in July 2011. Mark Ronson (Jonathan Short/Invision) 
He said: “Becoming a patron of the Amy Winehouse Foundation is a big deal to me. It’s very important to help the great work that they are already doing, both with substance misuse and helping talented disadvantaged youth through music. 
“Amy’s music touched so many and also helped them – and now through the Foundation, it continues to help people.” 
Hip-hop star Nas and producer Salaam Remi, who were friends with Amy, will also become patrons of the charity, while Ella Henderson, Jess Glynne, Foxes, The Voice 2014 winner Jermaine Jackman and Vanessa Feltz will be named ambassadors for the Amy Winehouse Foundation. We're delighted that @MarkRonson , @Nas and @SaLaAMReMi will be comfirmed as Patron's of the Amy Winehouse Foundation tomorrow night #AWFGala
